description: From Middle English need, nede, a merger of two terms:

entries.meaning: (countable and uncountable) A requirement for something; something needed.
Lack of means of subsistence; poverty; indigence; destitution.
(countable and uncountable) A requirement for something; something needed.
examples: There's no need to speculate; we can easily find out for sure.
She grew irritated with his constant need for attention.
Our needs are not being met.
I've always tried to have few needs beyond food, clothing and shelter.

verbs.description: need (third-person singular simple present needs, present participle needing, simple past and past participle needed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To have an absolute requirement for.
examples: Living things need water to survive.
You do not always need  to go to the library to study. You may use the Internet.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To want strongly; to feel that one must have something.
examples: After ten days of hiking, I needed a shower and a shave.

entries.meaning: (modal verb) To be obliged or required (to do something).
examples: You need not go if you don't want to.

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To be required; to be necessary.
